January 10, 1988: Fiction
THE TOMMYKNOCKERS, by Stephen King. (Putnam, $19.95.) Two writers'
zealous attempt to unearth mysterious artifacts creates nightmares in a Maine
village.
KALEIDOSCOPE, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $18.95.) Three sisters, separated
by fate, and the lawyer whose mission is to find and reunite them.
LEAVING HOME, by Garrison Keillor. (Viking, $18.95.) A collection of Lake
Wobegon monologues, from the radio program ''A Prairie Home Companion.''
THE BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES, by Tom Wolfe. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$19.95.) An investment banker caught in the jungles of New York.
PATRIOT GAMES, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $19.95.) The C.I.A.'s Jack Ryan
battles terrorists in England, Ireland and America.
PRESUMED INNOCENT, by Scott Turow. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $18.95.) A
brutal murder creates a crisis among a big city's politicians.
THE POLAR EXPRESS, written and illustrated by Chris Van Allsburg. (Houghton
Mifflin, $15.95.) A small boy's Christmas Eve train ride to the North Pole and the
magical events that follow.
HEAVEN AND HELL, by John Jakes. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $19.95.) A tale
of two families in the aftermath of the Civil War.
2061: Odyssey Three, by Arthur C. Clarke. (Del Rey/Ballantine, $17.95.)
Continuing the space saga begun in ''2001'' and ''2010.''
BELOVED, by Toni Morrison. (Knopf, $18.95.) Memories of her past haunt an
escaped slave in post-Civil War Ohio.
SARUM, by Edward Rutherfurd. (Crown, $19.95.) Ten thousand years of English
history, seen through the experiences of five families.
LEGACY, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $16.95.) The ordeal of a
military officer, charged with high crimes, whose family heritage covers 200 years
of constitutional history.
MISERY, by Stephen King. (Viking, $18.95.) Injured and drugged, an author is
held captive by a psychotic fan.
RUBBER LEGS AND WHITE TAIL-HAIRS, by Patrick F. McManus. (Holt, $14.95.)
Humorous tales about an outdoorsman's life.
WINTER, by Len Deighton. (Knopf, $19.95.) The experiences of a Berlin family,
from Kaiser Wilhelm to Adolf Hitler.
January 10, 1988
Non-Fiction
TIME FLIES, by Bill Cosby. (Dolphin/Doubleday, $15.95.) Counting his blessings
and his losses, the television star muses on life at 50.
FAMILY: The Ties That Bind . . . and Gag! by Erma Bombeck. (McGraw-Hill,
$15.95.) Anecdotes about a reunion of the humorist's grown children.
TRUMP: The Art of the Deal, by Donald J. Trump with Tony Schwartz. (Random
House, $19.95.) The career and business style of the New York entrepreneur.
THE CAT WHO CAME FOR CHRISTMAS, by Cleveland Amory. (Little, Brown,
$15.95.) A self- styled curmudgeon's memoir of a cat.
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AMERICA. (Collins Publishers, $39.95.) The nation on
May 2, 1986, as recorded in pictures by 200 photojournalists.
MAN OF THE HOUSE: The Life and Political Memoirs of Speaker Tip O'Neill, with
William Novak. (Random House, $19.95.) The former Speaker of the House tells
his story.
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE SOVIET UNION. (Collins Publishers, $39.95.) The
vast country on May 15, 1987, as recorded in pictures by 100 of the world's
leading photojournalists.
SPYCATCHER, by Peter Wright with Paul Greengrass. (Viking, $19.95.) The
autobiography of a former senior member of the British secret service.
THE NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC SOCIETY, by C. D. B. Bryan. (Abrams, $45.) The
100-year history of an American institution in pictures and words.
CHRONICLE OF THE 20TH CENTURY, edited by Clifton Daniel. (Chronicle
Publications, $49.95.) Profusely illustrated history of the world, month by month,
from 1900 through 1986.
VEIL, by Bob Woodward. (Simon & Schuster, $21.95.) The inside story of William
Casey's years at the helm of the C.I.A., 1981 to 1987.
SEVEN STORIES OF CHRISTMAS LOVE, by Leo Buscaglia. (Slack, $12.95.)
The advocate of caring and love recalls experiences during holidays past.
PERESTROIKA, by Mikhail Gorbachev. (Bessie/ Harper & Row, $19.95.) The
Soviet leader's views on changing his country and the world.
THE DISCOVERY OF THE TITANIC, by Robert D. Ballard with Rick Archbold.
(Madison Press/ Warner, $29.95.) Recent findings about the sinking of the
legendary ship 75 years ago.
I THINK I DON'T REMEMBER, by Art Buchwald. (Putnam, $16.95.) Humorous
